fileServer

Class FileServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileServer.FileServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IServe

    public class FileServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IServe
    This file server implements IServer interface and handle Get, head Post request.
    Since:
    25/11/2012
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Jiaqi LI

      Construct a file server by given root of server, requested URI and http version.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileServer

        public FileServer(java.lang.String httpVersion,
          java.lang.String documentRoot,
          java.lang.String requestURI)
        Construct a file server by given root of server, requested URI and http version.
        Parameters:
        httpVersion - the HTTP version could be HTTP/0.9 or HTTP/1.0.
        documentRoot - the document root of the server.
        requestURI - the request file.

    • Method Detail

      • httpHEAD

        public byte[] httpHEAD(java.lang.String requestURI)
                throws HTTPFileNotFoundException,
                       HTTPRuntimeException,
                       HTTPPermissionDeniedException
        Specified by:
        httpHEAD in interface IServe
        Parameters:
        requestURI - the Request-URI from the associated HEAD request
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the requested data
        Throws:
        HTTPFileNotFoundException - if the file specified by the Request-URI does not exist
        HTTPRuntimeException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is executable but did not execute correctly
        HTTPPermissionDeniedException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is not permissioned correctly for read or execution access (as appropriate)

                throws HTTPFileNotFoundException,
                       HTTPRuntimeException,
                       HTTPPermissionDeniedException
        Specified by:
        httpPOST in interface IServe
        Parameters:
        requestURI - the Request-URI from the associated POST request
        postData - an array of bytes containing the POST data from the POST request
        Returns:
        an array of bytes containing the requested data
        Throws:
        HTTPFileNotFoundException - if the file specified by the Request-URI does not exist
        HTTPRuntimeException - if the file specified by the Request-URI is executable but did not execute correctly

      • createFile

        public byte[] createFile(byte[] postData)
                  throws HTTPRuntimeException
        This method is called if the POST request encountered a HTTPFileNotFound error. This method will create the file (and any folder if nessary) with the post data.
        Parameters:
        postData - the body of POST request
        Returns:
        Throws:
        HTTPRuntimeException
